result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J. Neumann

defendant.name: Neumann, Brandon J.
defendant.address: 319 S Green Bay Av; #23, Gillett, WI 54124

records.addlTxt:
11:38 AM Defendant Brandon J. Neumann in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Brandon J. Neumann.  Attorney Amy Pautzke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Information reviewed and Deft. enters a GUILTY Plea to Count 1 w/repeater struck.  Plea quest. & waiver of rights reviewed.  Voting/Firearms.  Court finds plea made freely & voluntarily.   Court accepts plea and Deft. is adjudged guilty and orders a JOC entered into the record.  PSI Ordered.  Present bond cont'd.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
from Deft. re: payment plan w/response from court
9:28  Waives reading of information and enters NGP.
9:26  Defense argues bond.  Court denies motion.

9:23 AM Judge Judge's case due to time limits/availability Judge Conley is hearing it.  Prosecuting attorney Amy R. Greenwood Pautzke in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon J. Neumann in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Brandon J. Neumann.  PQW received/reviewed by Court. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:45 am.

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon J. Neumann in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Brandon J. Neumann.  Complaint reviewed.  Waive reading.  PH within time limits.  BB motion to be filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.

1:54 PM Defendant Brandon J. Neumann appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. SPD Spansail present for bond.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.  Bond is set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
